name: modillion
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
one of a set of decorative supports underneath the vertical part of a cornice (= a decorative border found where the ceiling meets the walls in some rooms, and also along the top of some walls and buildings): Modillions are a typical feature of the Roman Corinthian style of architecture. The farmhouse is built of brick, with a tiled roof and modillion cornice.
More examplesFewer examplesYou can see a series of small brackets, called modillions, that support the cornice.We are restoring the cornice, including all the wooden modillions and decorative mouldings.The modillion was used as a decorative feature on cornices from an early date.This modillion cornice is of an earlier date than the other one.
